subs.text: @jenrazzle @c0urtneyH I‚Äôve had Global Entry for a couple years and it is 100% worth it. I had to wait a few months to get approved and be told to make an appointment, and that was in good times.
subs.rawText: @jenrazzle @c0urtneyH I‚Äôve had Global Entry for a couple years and it is 100% worth it. I had to wait a few months to get approved and be told to make an appointment, and that was in good times.

subs.text: @jenrazzle @c0urtneyH Although it didn‚Äôt really pay off until my wife had it too. I‚Äôd get done with the kiosk in 2 minutes and wait for her 45 minutes to get through the line. And it is a bit creepy to not show your passport and enter on facial recognition alone.
subs.rawText: @jenrazzle @c0urtneyH Although it didn‚Äôt really pay off until my wife had it too. I‚Äôd get done with the kiosk in 2 minutes and wait for her 45 minutes to get through the line. And it is a bit creepy to not show your passport and enter on facial recognition alone.

subs.text: @NuwOne Ha! Would have loved a French breakfast at CDG, but too crowded so I had to wait for ‚Äúchicken or pasta‚Äù on the plane. Funniest thing was the lady on the first leg complaining that Air France did not offer wine at 6:30am!

subs.text: CDG was chaotic (strikes, but only a bit more chaos than usual for CDG). Passport control took 35 minutes), takeoff was an hour late. Woke up from my nap to see we‚Äôre approaching Greenland. [link]

subs.text: Just got a mail from Delta apologizing for not loading all checked luggage onto the plane. Crew hasn‚Äôt announced anything yet. Good thing I didn‚Äôt check anything!

subs.text: @deutschbitte My home LK Harburg offers 4th boosters to all adults 6 months after the 3rd. There are 4 stations in Winsen, Fleestedt, Neu Wulmstorf and Buchholz. We don‚Äôt have 4th boosters yet, this is the info from the LK. [link]
